div.p: From Charles Topp to Alexander Peacock
D96/8562, unit 901, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See also G. Luehmann to C. Topp, 14 October 1896 (in this edition as M96-10-14).

div.p: Mr George French has been engaged at 4/. a day for the past 11 years and paid by Baron Von Mueller out of his own pocket as an assistant.

The late Baron also employed and himself paid three other assistants 15/. a week each. The Executors have notified all three that their engagements are terminated. As the Govt Botanist used his own house as his office his public & private collections & books & correspondence are mixed together and occupy six rooms; Mr G. French is familiar with these and I recommend strongly that he be engaged for three months at 4/. a day to assist Mr Luehmann in going through (with the Executors) the collections, books &c and reporting those which belong to the Government. He can also assist in the general work

As there is no contingency vote for the "Government Botanist" an advance of £15.15/. will be needed to pay Mr French to [be]
word omitted. met by a vote on the Supplementary Estimates
The Chief Secretary, Alexander Peacock, minuted his approval on the file.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: A sum of about £15 will also be needed for contingencies (stationery, foreign postage, trams &c) as the late Baron paid for all these himself.
